author: Olgun Uluc and Liam FitzGibbon
title: Jarryd Hayne NFL live 49ers v Ravens: video, blog, updates, scores, San Francisco 49ers v Baltimore Ravens, where can I follow it
text:
Video Image Jarryd Hayne: 'Devastated with fumble' 0:33 NFL: The San Francisco 49ers came away with a 5-point win over Baltimore, but it wasn't all smiles for running back Jarryd Hayne.
October 19th 2015 2 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/More Sports/ Jarryd Hayne had a shaky start to the game. Can he recover?
Olgun Uluc and Liam FitzGibbon FOX SPORTS JARRYD Hayne fumbled a punt and didn’t impact the game as expected but the San Francisco 49ers avoided their fourth loss in a row with a 25-20 win over the Ravens
Hayne was expected to see an increased role due to the absence of Reggie Bush, primary kick returner Bruce Ellington, along with top running back Carlos Hyde’s niggling foot injury.
But the Aussie had one of his quietest games yet on a frustrating afternoon that started off on the wrong foot.
INMAN VERDICT: HAYNE’S GROWING PAINS WERE EXPECTED
Jarryd Hayne had one of the quietest games of his NFL career. Source: AFP
The former NRL star’s first punt return began well enough as he avoided a number of Ravens defenders with some fancy footwork.
But a tackle from behind from Baltimore’s Anthony Levine resulted in him spilling the ball for the third time in Hayne’s budding NFL career.
Luckily, it wasn’t costly as the 49ers recovered the ball and went on to score the opening points of the match, but Hayne admitted it was another incident he needed to learn from.
“I was obviously devastated with the fumble,” Hayne told reporters.
“We always talk about it; ‘the most dangerous man is the man you don’t see’
“I’m sure I’ll be asked about that during the week and for me, I kind of felt like behind was clear and I went for that little bit extra.
San Francisco 49ers back in winner's circle 0:58 NFL: Jarryd Hayne's 49ers defeated Baltimore 25-20 at Levi's Stadium, but the former Parramatta star made another forgettable fumble.
October 19th 2015 2 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/More Sports/ “I knew if I beat that one guy and the guy wasn’t behind me, it was just me and the punter and the (blocking) boys were there.
“It’s obviously one of those things you’ve got to learn from. The most important thing is protecting the ball.”
Hayne’s only other touch was fair catch late in the first half. He lined up at running back a handful of times but didn’t get a touch, with his effectiveness in a blocking role also coming under scrutiny.
Hayne also took the field for a late kickoff return but again didn’t get his hands on the ball as the Ravens continued to put kicks over the end zone.
A second-half injury to Hyde — who shouldered the bulk of running back duties despite his foot problem — looked like it could open the door for Hayne but Hyde was able to continue.
Jarryd Hayne returns a punt against the Baltimore Ravens. Source: Getty Images
Quarterback Colin Kaepernick re-discovered his mojo to earn man of the match with 340-pass yards and no interceptions in regular play.
49ers coach Jim Tomsula felt his side got back to basics.
“We’re measured by the wins and losses columns,” he said.
“Getting one in the left column is important for us.
“The guys come to work every day. I see them getting better every day. This is a good team. It’s a good group of guys willing to work.
“Every time you win it’s a very good thing.”
Hayne was watched at Levi’s Stadium by a group of current and former NRL stars including legendary halfback Andrew Johns, Tony Williams, Willie Tonga and former teammates Krisnan Inu and Feleti Mateo.
#38 all day @jarrydhayne38 #UceCrew +JOEY LOL.. #2566 #AustraliansInSanFran @49ers #levistadium
A photo posted by Krisnan Inu (@krisnan_inu_) on Oct 18, 2015 at 3:14pm PDT
In a game that was expected to showcase both team’s kickers, the 49ers and Ravens traded field goals, with San Francisco leading 6-3 early in the second quarter.
The 49ers then extended their lead, with Colin Kaepernick throwing a 76-yard touchdown pass to Torrey Smith who used the stutter step to burn Shareece Wright, giving San Francisco a 13-3 advantage.
In what was their fourth offensive possession with a score in a row, the 49ers continued to build on their lead, this time with another Phil Dawson field goal to extend their advantage to 16-3 midway through the second quarter.
After another Ravens field foal, Hayne’s rough start seemingly got worse, with the Aussie failing to pick up linebacker Daryl Smith as his quarterback was sacked on third-down.
Colin Kaepenrick sacked on third down when Jarryd Hayne failed to pick up blitzing linebacker Daryl Smith
— Cam Inman (@CamInman) October 18, 2015 Hayne ended the half with a fair catch, doing well to take an awkward ball that he perhaps should have left, inside the 10-yard line as the 49ers entered the halftime break with a 16-6 lead.
The second half opened with yet another field goal, with Phil Dawson’s fourth of the game extending the 49ers’ lead to 19-6 midway through the third quarter.
Steve Smith, who had two fumbles in the endzone in the first half, finally managed to get on the board, leaping for a 34-yard pass from Joe Flacco for the Ravens’ first touchdown of the game.
Colin Kaepernick celebrates with guard Alex Boone after a 21-yard touchdown pass. Source: AFP
To open the final quarter, Kaepernick found Quinton Patton wide open in the endzone for his first career touchdown. The 49ers failed to convert the conversion but still held a 25-13 lead early in the fourth quarter.
The Ravens responded with a score of their own, with Flacco finding Kamar Aiken for a 2-yard touchdown, cutting the 49ers lead to 25-20 with 5:14 remaining in the game.
A last-ditch effort from the Ravens was unsuccessful as the 49ers held their own on the defensive end to end their four-game losing streak.
Jarryd Hayne fumbles on opening return 0:46 NFL: Not the start he was after - former Parramatta star Jarryd Hayne has fumbled an early opportunity for a punt return against the Baltimore Ravens.
October 19th 2015 2 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/More Sports/ Hayne won’t have to wait long for a chance to put in an improved performance.
He and the 49ers face a short week, with their next game against arch rivals the Seattle Seahawks on Thursday (11.25am Friday morning AEDT)
“It’s all about preparation, we’ll get back into it tomorrow and start preparing for Seattle,” Hayne said.
“There’s no days off and no time to unwind.
“It’s a three day prep and then game day. It’s my first time doing it (in the NFL) but I’ve done it back home (in rugby league) and it’s all about getting the body right.”
Re-live the match in our live blog below!
Originally published as Hayne ‘devastated’ by fumble in 49ers’ win
